title: Women participating in decisionmaking vs. children per woman
subtitle: Women aged 15-49 who participate in deciding their own healthcare, major household purchases, and visiting family. Children per woman defined as the average number of children that would be born to a woman over her lifetime if the woman were to experience the exact current age-specific fertility rates, and the woman were to survive from birth to the end of her reproductive career.

display.name: % Women participating in decisionmaking
display.unit: own health care, major household purchases, and visiting family % of women age 15-49

sourceDesc: UN, World Population Prospects (2022); Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) via World Bank
